      • corner1

        public static boolean corner1(int i,
                              int j)
        Checks if the sphere is added in the top left hand corner of the grid.
        Parameters:
        i - This tells us the row of the Integer matrix (in the back end) to be accessed
        j - This tells us the column of the Integer matrix (in the back end) to be accessed
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the sphere is in that corner

      • backburst

        public static void backburst(int[][] b,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int i)
        This function is used for an extra grid that is maintained in the back end. This was done because the updation of the grid was slowed down due to animations which was needed for serializing it and for checking if a Player has been eliminated or not.
        Parameters:
        b - This is an integer matrix in which the changes are made
        x - This is an integer representing the row no. of the grid
        y - This is an integer representing the column no. of the grid
        i - This is an integer representing which Player it is

      • conquer

        public static void conquer(javafx.scene.Group[][] r,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           javafx.scene.shape.Sphere s,
                           javafx.scene.Group root,
                           javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] grid2)
        This function is called inside burst() to update the grid after there has a change in it if one of the cells had more than spheres than the permissible limit.
        Parameters:
        r - This a 2D array of Group representing each cell in the front end Grid
        x - This is an integer representing the row no. of the grid
        y - This is an integer representing the column no. of the grid
        s - This is the new sphere that has to be added at r[x][y]
        root - This is the main Group in which r and other components of the grid are present
        grid2 - This is a 2D array of rectangles present in the grid that are needed to find the centre of the cell in which the Sphere is to be added

      • checkWinner

        public static boolean checkWinner(javafx.scene.Group[][] r)
        This function is called to check if we have a winner. It does so by checking if there are two or more different colored Spheres present in the Grid
        Parameters:
        r - This a 2D array of Group representing each cell in the front end Grid
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if the winner has been found

      • updateplayers

        public static int[] updateplayers(int[][] t)
        This function is used to check if the any Player no longer has even a single Sphere in the Grid or not
        Parameters:
        t - This is a 2D Integer matrix which is the back end grid which is being maintained.
        Returns:
        int[] This is an array in which if the value is zero then it implies that Player has been eliminated

      • burst

        public static void burst(javafx.scene.Group[][] r,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int i,
                         javafx.scene.Group root,
                         javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] grid2)
        This function is used for the front end Grid that is maintained. the translation animation if there are more than permissible no. of Spheres is being carried out here. Also the write(), checkinner() are called in it.
        Parameters:
        r - This a 2D array of Group representing each cell in the front end Grid
        x - This is an integer representing the row no. of the grid
        y - This is an integer representing the column no. of the grid
        s - This is the new sphere that has to be added at r[x][y]
        root - This is the main Group in which r and other components of the grid are present
        grid2 - This is a 2D array of rectangles present in the grid that are needed to find the centre of the cell in which the Sphere is to be added

      • find

        public static javafx.scene.shape.Sphere find(javafx.scene.shape.Sphere s,
                                             javafx.scene.Group r)
        This function is used by play() to get a sphere present in the requested Group and then use that sphere to ensure it has the same color as the color assigned to the Player making the move.
        Parameters:
        s - This is the Sphere to be searched for
        r - This is the group in which we wish to know if there is Sphere or not.
        Returns:
        Sphere returns a sphere if there is any in that group

      • play

        public void play(int gx1,
                 int gy1,
                 int gx2,
                 int gy2,
                 float sbs,
                 float bbs,
                 double rad,
                 double rt,
                 boolean axy)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is the most important function in which the grid of the requested size is created and the input made by the Player are handled here i.e. adding a sphere, ensuring it has same color as the one that might be already present in that cell of the grid, calling burst() function, functionality of the undo button.
        Parameters:
        -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • check

        public static void check(javafx.scene.Group[][] r,
                         javafx.scene.Group root,
                         javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] grid2,
                         javafx.scene.paint.PhongMaterial[] m,
                         double rad,
                         int[][] beforeundo)
        This function is called when undo button is pressed from the recreate() function. This based on the data provided by the beforeundo matrix creates the front end Grid
        Parameters:
        r - This a 2D array of Group representing each cell in the front end Grid
        root - This is the main Group in which r and other components of the grid are present
        grid2 - This is a 2D array of rectangles present in the grid that are needed to find the centre of the cell in which the Sphere is to be added
        m - This is a 1D array of PhongMaterial the different materials that a sphere can have
        rad - This is the radius of the sphere to be added in a cell of the grid.
        beforeundo - This is a 2D Integer matrix of the back end grid
